title: Factor the Perfect Square
text: In this case, we can see that 4n**2+4n+1as $${\left(a x\right)}^2+2a b x$$ + $$b^2={\left(a x+b\right)}^2$$ where $$ax=2n$$ and $$b=1$$. We can factor $$4n^2+4n+1$$ as $${\left(2n+1\right)}^2$$.

title: Use Square Root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=\sqrt{k}$$. $${\left(2n+1\right)}^2=16$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$2n+1=4$$ or $$2n+1=-4$$.

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$4n^2+4n+1=16$$ has two solutions which are $$n=\frac{-5}{2}$$ and $$n=\frac{3}{2}$$.
speech: Therefore,  4 n squared, plus 4 n plus 1 is equal to 16  has two solutions which are  n, is equal to fraction, negative 5, over 2,   and  n is equal to 3 halves .
